30#ifndef TTM_MEMORY_H
31#define TTM_MEMORY_H
32
33#include <linux/workqueue.h>
34#include <linux/spinlock.h>
35#include <linux/bug.h>
36#include <linux/wait.h>
37#include <linux/errno.h>
38#include <linux/kobject.h>
39#include <linux/mm.h>
40
41struct page;
42
43/**
44 * struct ttm_mem_shrink - callback to shrink TTM memory usage.
45 *
46 * @do_shrink: The callback function.
47 *
48 * Arguments to the do_shrink functions are intended to be passed using
49 * inheritance. That is, the argument class derives from struct ttm_mem_shrink,
50 * and can be accessed using container_of().
51 */
52
53struct ttm_mem_shrink {
54 int (*do_shrink) (struct ttm_mem_shrink *);
55};
56
57/**
58 * struct ttm_mem_global - Global memory accounting structure.
59 *
60 * @shrink: A single callback to shrink TTM memory usage. Extend this
61 * to a linked list to be able to handle multiple callbacks when needed.
62 * @swap_queue: A workqueue to handle shrinking in low memory situations. We
63 * need a separate workqueue since it will spend a lot of time waiting
64 * for the GPU, and this will otherwise block other workqueue tasks(?)
65 * At this point we use only a single-threaded workqueue.
66 * @work: The workqueue callback for the shrink queue.
67 * @lock: Lock to protect the @shrink - and the memory accounting members,
68 * that is, essentially the whole structure with some exceptions.
69 * @zones: Array of pointers to accounting zones.
70 * @num_zones: Number of populated entries in the @zones array.
71 * @zone_kernel: Pointer to the kernel zone.
72 * @zone_highmem: Pointer to the highmem zone if there is one.
73 * @zone_dma32: Pointer to the dma32 zone if there is one.
74 *
75 * Note that this structure is not per device. It should be global for all
76 * graphics devices.
77 */
78
79#define TTM_MEM_MAX_ZONES 2
80struct ttm_mem_zone;
81struct ttm_mem_global {
82#ifndef __NetBSD__
83 struct kobject kobj;
84#endif
85 struct ttm_mem_shrink *shrink;
86 struct workqueue_struct *swap_queue;
87 struct work_struct work;
88 spinlock_t lock;
89 struct ttm_mem_zone *zones[TTM_MEM_MAX_ZONES];
90 unsigned int num_zones;
91 struct ttm_mem_zone *zone_kernel;
92#ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
93 struct ttm_mem_zone *zone_highmem;
94#else
95 struct ttm_mem_zone *zone_dma32;
96#endif
97};
98
99/**
100 * ttm_mem_init_shrink - initialize a struct ttm_mem_shrink object
101 *
102 * @shrink: The object to initialize.
103 * @func: The callback function.
104 */
105
106static inline void ttm_mem_init_shrink(struct ttm_mem_shrink *shrink,
107 int (*func) (struct ttm_mem_shrink *))
108{
109 shrink->do_shrink = func;
110}
111
112/**
113 * ttm_mem_register_shrink - register a struct ttm_mem_shrink object.
114 *
115 * @glob: The struct ttm_mem_global object to register with.
116 * @shrink: An initialized struct ttm_mem_shrink object to register.
117 *
118 * Returns:
119 * -EBUSY: There's already a callback registered. (May change).
120 */
121
122static inline int ttm_mem_register_shrink(struct ttm_mem_global *glob,
123 struct ttm_mem_shrink *shrink)
124{
125 spin_lock(&glob->lock);
126 if (glob->shrink != NULL) {
127 spin_unlock(&glob->lock);
128 return -EBUSY;
129 }
130 glob->shrink = shrink;
131 spin_unlock(&glob->lock);
132 return 0;
133}
134
135/**
136 * ttm_mem_unregister_shrink - unregister a struct ttm_mem_shrink object.
137 *
138 * @glob: The struct ttm_mem_global object to unregister from.
139 * @shrink: A previously registert struct ttm_mem_shrink object.
140 *
141 */
142
143static inline void ttm_mem_unregister_shrink(struct ttm_mem_global *glob,
144 struct ttm_mem_shrink *shrink)
145{
146 spin_lock(&glob->lock);
147 BUG_ON(glob->shrink != shrink);
148 glob->shrink = NULL;
149 spin_unlock(&glob->lock);
150}
151
152extern int ttm_mem_global_init(struct ttm_mem_global *glob);
153extern void ttm_mem_global_release(struct ttm_mem_global *glob);
154extern int ttm_mem_global_alloc(struct ttm_mem_global *glob, uint64_t memory,
155 bool no_wait, bool interruptible);
156extern void ttm_mem_global_free(struct ttm_mem_global *glob,
157 uint64_t amount);
158extern int ttm_mem_global_alloc_page(struct ttm_mem_global *glob,
159 struct page *page,
160 bool no_wait, bool interruptible);
161extern void ttm_mem_global_free_page(struct ttm_mem_global *glob,
162 struct page *page);
163extern size_t ttm_round_pot(size_t size);
164#endif
165
